name: Ain't By Numbers Quiz | By The Numbers | 10 Questions

questions.text: Putting it in Roman Numerals, what year did author Edith Wharton pass away?
questions.explanation:
MCMXXXVII.

	Author Edith Wharton passed away from a stroke on August 11, 1937. She wrote many novels, including "The Age of Innocence" (1920).

questions.text: Write the number '32' using Roman Numerals.
questions.explanation:
XXXII.

	The number ten using Roman Numerals is an X. Three X's would make thirty. The number two would be displayed using two IIs.

questions.text: How many "little Indians" in the children's song are used to help children count with their fingers?
questions.explanation:
X.

	The children's song is used to help children count forward and backward with their fingers. The Roman Numeral X stands for the number ten.

questions.text: Written in Roman Numerals, how many days are in the month of June?
questions.explanation:
XXX.

	According to the poem, there are thirty days in June. Thirty is represented in Roman Numerals by three Xs, as each X equals ten.

questions.text: If you add 500 plus 5 together, what number do you get?
questions.explanation:
DV.

	The Roman Numeral D stands for 500 and V stands for 5, so DV is the Roman Numeral equivalent of 505.

questions.text: This quiz was made in the year 2013. If Funtrivia.com sticks around for another sixty years after 2013, what year will it be?
questions.explanation:
MMLXXIII.

	With this quiz being made in the year 2013, if Funtrivia.com is still around in sixty years that will make the year 2073.

questions.text: In what year did Holy Roman Emperor Henry III's second wife, Agnes, die?
questions.explanation:
MLXXVII.

	Agnes of Poitou died in December of 1077. She and her husband, Holy Roman Emperor Henry III, had seven children together.

questions.text: If Janice had 500 fliers to take around the neighborhood, and Owen added nine more to her pile, how many fliers would Janice have in all?
questions.explanation:
DIX.

	Janice would have had 509 fliers. With the Roman Numeral D standing for 500 and IX standing for the number 9, you get DIX.

questions.text: Putting it in Roman Numeral form, how old was the Biblical Methuselah when he died?
questions.explanation:
CMLXIX.

	According to the King James Version of the Bible, Methuselah was 969 years old when he died. The year 900 would be represented by CM and the year 69 would be represented by an L, one X, and an IX.

questions.text: This quiz was written in the year 2013. How would that be written in Roman Numerals?
questions.explanation:
MMXIII.

	The year 2013 has seen the deaths of Hugo Chavez, Margaret Thatcher, and Esther Williams. MM equals 2000 and XIII equals 13, so MMXIII equals 2013.
